programme.title: Touchez pas au grisbi
programme.desc: Film policier.

programme.title: La maison des otages
programme.desc: Au milieu des années 1950, dans une bourgade des États-Unis. Quatre ans après avoir froidement avoir abattu un policier, Glenn Griffin parvient à s'évader de prison, avec la complicité de son frère Hal et de Kobish, une brute épaisse. Après avoir assommé un fermier et volé sa voiture, les trois malfrats font irruption dans la maison des Hilliard et prennent la famille en otage, dans l’attente d’une grosse somme d’argent pour quitter le pays. Face à ces agresseurs prêts à tout, Dan, le père, tente tout son possible pour sauver sa femme et ses deux enfants.

programme.title: Le témoin à abattre
programme.desc: Après une course-poursuite dans les rues de Gênes et sa banlieue, le commissaire Belli parvient à arrêter un trafiquant de drogues nommé le Libanais. Mais devant le commissariat, la voiture de police où figure le truand est plastiquée. Le commissaire, qui a échappé de peu à l’attentat, se met en tête de remonter le fil de l’affaire et d’arrêter le coupable. Mais il se heurte rapidement à l’inertie et à l’incompétence de sa hiérarchie. Et son obstination n’est aucunement du goût de très hautes personnalités génoises, qui sont impliquées dans son enquête.

programme.title: Une fille pour le diable
programme.desc: Michael Raynor, un prêtre défroque et excommunié a quitté la Grande Bretagne pour la Bavière et a fondé un Ordre très particulier dans un ancien monastère : des jeunes filles habillées en religieuses sont instruites dans l'adoration d'un maître qui n'est autre qu'Astaroth, avatar du Diable. Catherine Beddows, une jeune novice, est choisie pour être son incarcération sur terre, et répandre son enseignement. Présent à Londres pour faire la promotion de son nouveau livre, John Verney, spécialiste de l'occultisme, est contacté par les parents de Catherine.

programme.title: Tod Browning, le jeu des illusions
programme.desc: Uniquement connu en France pour son "Dracula", Tod Browning est un cinéaste oublié quand, dans les années 1960, quelques cinéphiles redécouvrent sa filmographie. Sa mort n'a, à l'époque, provoqué aucune réaction, ni aucun hommage de la part du milieu du cinéma hollywoodien. Cette injustice est désormais réparée puisque Tod Browning est aujourd'hui reconnu comme un virtuose de l'étrange. Ce documentaire revient sur sa carrière au cirque, ses débuts au cinéma sous l'égide de Griffith. D'abord acteur, puis scénariste et enfin réalisateur, Tod Browning a signé de très nombreux films muets. Il laisse une filmographie aux thèmes souvent effrayants, qui joue sur les faux-semblants, les illusions et la manipulation, une oeuvre qui ne craint ni la violence des sentiments, ni celle des actes.

programme.title: Jenny
programme.desc: Danielle est pianiste à Londres. Après une déception sentimentale, elle rentre à Paris chez sa mère Jenny qui tient une maison de rendez-vous clandestine. Mais peu après son arrivée, elle s'éprend de Lucien, l'amant de Jenny.

programme.title: Traitement de choc
programme.desc: Film de suspense.

programme.title: La vie à l'envers
programme.desc: Drame.

programme.title: Snobs !
programme.desc: Le P.D.G. d'une importante coopérative laitière vient de mourir en se noyant accidentellement dans une cuve de lait. La succession est ouverte. Quatre directeurs adjoints lorgnent la place et tous les coups sont permis. La première étape consiste à obtenir l'exclusivité des commandes de lait dans les établissements scolaires de la région. Le dénommé Courtin a la bonne idée de profiter du snobisme de ses rivaux pour les discréditer les uns après les autres.

programme.title: Colorado
programme.desc: Colorado Corbett, un chasseur de primes, est encore plus populaire au Texas que le pionnier David Crockett. Corbett est chargé par Brokston, un homme d'affaires mexicain, de retrouver Cuchillo Sanchez, un individu accusé d'avoir violé et tué une adolescente de 12 ans à coups de couteau. Corbett ne tarde pas à le retrouver. Mais le pauvre paysan clame son innocence, et parvient à s'enfuir à cheval.

programme.title: La blonde et le shérif
programme.desc: Western.

programme.title: Viva l'Italia
programme.desc: En 1860, l’Italie est divisée en huit états. Afin de parvenir à unifier le pays, le général Giuseppe Garibaldi part à la conquête de la Sicile à la tête du corps d'armée qu'il a levé lui-même. L'expédition des Mille débarque à Marsala. De nouveaux volontaires, issus des campagnes, viennent chaque jour se joindre à ses troupes en route vers Palerme. Les Bourbons sont vite contraints de demander un armistice. Après cette victoire, Garibaldi et ses hommes rejoignent alors les armées piémontaises à Naples dans l’espoir de parvenir à l’unification de l’Italie.

programme.title: Accattone
programme.desc: Vittorio Cataldi, surnommé «Accatone» par tout son entourage, mène une existence misérable dans les faubourgs de Rome. Il vit des charmes de Maddalena. Mais la jeune femme est arrêtée par la police et se retrouve aussitôt en prison. Peu de temps après, Accattone fait la connaissance de la belle Stella dont il tombe follement amoureux. Touché par l'innocence et la douceur de la jeune femme, il se refuse à la mettre sur le trottoir. L'homme décide alors de changer d'existence et de gagner sa vie honnêtement.

programme.title: Sirocco
programme.desc: En 1925, dans une Syrie occupée par les forces françaises, l'émir Hassan est à la tête d'un mouvement de patriotes qui se rebellent contre l'armée française. A Damas, tenue par le général Lasalle et ses hommes, les combattants d'Hassan oeuvrent dans la clandestinité pour monter des opérations contre les militaires français. Après une nouvelle opération qui a coûté la vie de plusieurs soldats, Lassalle ordonne des représailles violentes et dissuasives. Sous ses ordres, l'impitoyable colonel Feroud entre en contact avec Harry Smith, un marchand d'armes américain.

I love New York and now I realise that part of the soul of the city lies in this incredible institution. Man it is good to see powerful people who care! And people from all walks of life who care! programme.title: Jane Birkin, simple icône
programme.desc: Sa longue frange, son accent British et son couple avec Serge Gainsbourg dans les années 1970 ont marqué les imaginaires. À la fois actrice et mère, muse et militante, chanteuse et sex-symbol, Jane Birkin a traversé les époques depuis cinquante ans avec un panache qui l’a érigée au rang d’icône. De scènes de vie en sessions d’enregistrements, d’extraits de films en interviews, où l’actrice et chanteuse révèle son espièglerie, la réalisatrice Clélia Cohen éclaire les multiples visages d'une femme intemporelle.

programme.title: 2020, la vie sur Terre
programme.desc: Le 16 mars 2020, la pandémie de Covid-19 se propage et la France se prépare au confinement. Le monde s'arrête. Six réalisateurs filment jusqu'à son terme ce temps de confinement. De ces six récits, Stéphane Jourdain et Dominique Auvray ont fait un seul film.

programme.title: Mords-les !
programme.desc: Brigitte Fontaine, une authentique enfant de la cité du Viaduc, déambule dans les rues de Morlaix.

programme.title: Soul Kitchen
Soul Kitchen
programme.desc: Soul Kitchen: Directed by Fatih Akin. With Adam Bousdoukos, Moritz Bleibtreu, Pheline Roggan, Anna Bederke. In Hamburg, German-Greek chef Zinos unknowingly disturbs the peace in his locals-only restaurant by hiring a more talented chef." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1244668/","name":"Soul Kitchen","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDg3MGIyYWEtOGRkYS00NWY5LWI3MDctMDY1NWJjZDlkOGE1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDk3NzU2MTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"In Hamburg, German-Greek chef Zinos unknowingly disturbs the peace in his locals-only restaurant by hiring a more talented chef.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1244668/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kosmasp"},"dateCreated":"2010-03-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"If you smell, what Faith is cookin ...","reviewBody":"You could be excused, if by hearing the title, you'd thought this is yet another "urban" comedy, starring Martin Lawrence or Ice Cube or Queen Latifah. It ain't so. While the title might be misleading (in quite a few ways), the characters in this aren't. You have finely structured people (with a cliché here and there), who seem to have their everyday problems and find a way to live with them.\n\nOur main character has quite a few struggles to go through this movie, some of them come "back" at him (no pun intended). And while quite a few things are more than cliché (the brother and what he does towards the end, is borderline believable, even with the setup through the movie), it has quite a few nice touches to it. All in all, a warm comedy, that goes more for the heart than the brain. A nice change of pace by Faith Akin and a movie, whose flaws shouldn't hinder you enjoying it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":37570,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2009-12-25","keywords":"restaurant,chef,cook,2000s,burglar","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Soul Kitchen","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3270837785","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ0MTM1MjYzNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjc0OTUyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ0MTM1MjYzNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjc0OTUyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"In Hamburg, German-Greek chef Zinos unknowingly disturbs the peace in his locals-only restaurant by hiring a more talented chef."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0100196/","name":"Adam Bousdoukos"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001953/","name":"Moritz Bleibtreu"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2114493/","name":"Pheline Roggan"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0015359/","name":"Fatih Akin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0090290/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0123730/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0190323/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0015359/","name":"Fatih Akin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0100196/","name":"Adam Bousdoukos"}],"duration":"PT1H39M"}</script><metacontent="

Garçon !
programme.desc: Garçon!: Directed by Claude Sautet. With Yves Montand, Nicole Garcia, Jacques Villeret, Rosy Varte. Director and star had worked very well together in Cesar et Rosalie and Vincent, Paul...; here they are doing a less-interesting script with too many characters and too many plot developments.\n\nMontand is, as ever, very watchable; here he is a waiter in a prestigious restaurant who is trying to get financing to open an amusement park. credits.actor: Franck Bruneau, Zoé Héran, Côme Levin

programme.title: Frost/Nixon
Frost/Nixon, l'heure de verité
programme.desc:
Frost/Nixon: Directed by Ron Howard. With Frank Langella, Michael Sheen, Sam Rockwell, Kevin Bacon. A dramatic retelling of the post-Watergate television interviews between British talk-show host David Frost and former president Richard Nixon." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0870111/","name":"Frost/Nixon","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTY4NTU2NTU4NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjE0OTc5MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A dramatic retelling of the post-Watergate television interviews between British talk-show host David Frost and former president Richard Nixon.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0870111/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"IMDb-627"},"dateCreated":"2008-10-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not to be missed! Vey rewarding","reviewBody":"I had the pleasure of watching this gripping movie at the opening night of the British Film festival. Ron Howard's direction and story telling ability are in top form with this effort. From the very first scene a carefully crafted and very credible 70s's atmosphere sets a solid stage for the superbly cast film and quickly transports the viewer into the political jungle that was "Tricky Dickey's" playground.

The acting duo of Frank Langella & Micheal Sheen (Nixon & Frost) are set on a collision course that finds two deeply passionate personalities at the mercy of their insatiable desires. Both actor's portrayals are a study of affectation and body language, pleasurably accurate and yet not simply an impersonation. Indeed, the film never strays from the distinct Howard format that breathes so much life (read intimacy) into this familiar and yet mysterious relationship that exists for so many people who lived through the exceptional event.

Make no mistake, this is by no means a two man show, quite the contrary. In fact, the wealth of supporting roles is perhaps the finest feature of this production. Bacon's devoted and stalwart marine practically glints of gun metal and polished shoe leather. The trio of Gould, Platt and Rockwell portray effortlessly the roles of the men who, brick by brick, constructed the platform from which Frost so successfully and serendipitously elicited one of the greatest unspoken confessions of all time. Rebecca Hall is delicious and demure, constantly filling scenes with her elegant presence.

Perhaps the richest praise should be reserved for Peter Morgan, who has, without question, penned a truly captivating and insightful story that delivers not only a satisfying comprehension of a complex time in US history, but captures a generation's struggle to come to terms with the frailty of leadership that still echoes today.

Not to be missed, this film can be enjoyed on multiple levels and will undoubtedly be regarded as seminal for it's engrossing insight and expert depiction.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":105950,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Drama","History"],"datePublished":"2009-01-23","keywords":"watergate,based on real person,interview,telephone call,reference to john f. kennedy","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Frost/Nixon: Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3600351257","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI4MzUwMjQ4NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjMzNzg4MQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI4MzUwMjQ4NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjMzNzg4MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"This is the first theatrical trailer for Ron Howard's Frost/Nixon."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001449/","name":"Frank Langella"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0790688/","name":"Michael Sheen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000102/","name":"Kevin Bacon"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000165/","name":"Ron Howard"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003687/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0057311/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0604948/","name":"Peter Morgan"}],"duration":"PT2H2M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.review: --- Actors: Frank Langella (role=Richard Nixon), Michael Sheen (role=David Frost), Sam Rockwell (role=James Reston, Jr.), Kevin Bacon (role=Jack Brennan), Matthew Macfadyen (role=John Birt), Oliver Platt (role=Bob Zelnick), Rebecca Hall (role=Caroline Cushing), Toby Jones (role=Swifty Lazar), Andy Milder (role=Frank Gannon), Kate Jennings Grant (role=Diane Sawyer), Gabriel Jarret (role=Ken Khachigian), Jim Meskimen (role=Ray Price)

IMDb data; ttnr: 0870111, Title: Frost/Nixon, --- Description: Frost/Nixon: Directed by Ron Howard. With Frank Langella, Michael Sheen, Sam Rockwell, Kevin Bacon. A dramatic retelling of the post-Watergate television interviews between British talk-show host David Frost and former president Richard Nixon." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0870111/","name":"Frost/Nixon","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTY4NTU2NTU4NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjE0OTc5MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A dramatic retelling of the post-Watergate television interviews between British talk-show host David Frost and former president Richard Nixon.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0870111/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"IMDb-627","dateCreated":"2008-10-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not to be missed! Vey rewarding","reviewBody":"I had the pleasure of watching this gripping movie at the opening night of the British Film festival. Ron Howard's direction and story telling ability are in top form with this effort. From the very first scene a carefully crafted and very credible 70s's atmosphere sets a solid stage for the superbly cast film and quickly transports the viewer into the political jungle that was "Tricky Dickey's" playground.

The acting duo of Frank Langella & Micheal Sheen (Nixon & Frost) are set on a collision course that finds two deeply passionate personalities at the mercy of their insatiable desires. Both actor's portrayals are a study of affectation and body language, pleasurably accurate and yet not simply an impersonation. Indeed, the film never strays from the distinct Howard format that breathes so much life (read intimacy) into this familiar and yet mysterious relationship that exists for so many people who lived through the exceptional event.

Make no mistake, this is by no means a two man show, quite the contrary. In fact, the wealth of supporting roles is perhaps the finest feature of this production. Bacon's devoted and stalwart marine practically glints of gun metal and polished shoe leather. The trio of Gould, Platt and Rockwell portray effortlessly the roles of the men who, brick by brick, constructed the platform from which Frost so successfully and serendipitously elicited one of the greatest unspoken confessions of all time. Rebecca Hall is delicious and demure, constantly filling scenes with her elegant presence.

Perhaps the richest praise should be reserved for Peter Morgan, who has, without question, penned a truly captivating and insightful story that delivers not only a satisfying comprehension of a complex time in US history, but captures a generation's struggle to come to terms with the frailty of leadership that still echoes today.

Not to be missed, this film can be enjoyed on multiple levels and will undoubtedly be regarded as seminal for it's engrossing insight and expert depiction.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":105950,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Drama","History"],"datePublished":"2009-01-23","keywords":"watergate,based on real person,interview,telephone call,reference to john f. kennedy","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Frost/Nixon: Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3600351257","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI4MzUwMjQ4NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjMzNzg4MQ@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI4MzUwMjQ4NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjMzNzg4MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"This is the first theatrical trailer for Ron Howard's Frost/Nixon.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001449/","name":"Frank Langella","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0790688/","name":"Michael Sheen","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000102/","name":"Kevin Bacon"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000165/","name":"Ron Howard"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003687/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0057311/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0604948/","name":"Peter Morgan"],"duration":"PT2H2M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Magic Mike
Magic Mike
programme.desc: Magic Mike: Directed by Steven Soderbergh. With Matthew McConaughey, Channing Tatum, Olivia Munn, Alex Pettyfer. A male stripper teaches a younger performer how to party, pick up women, and make easy money." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1915581/","name":"Magic Mike","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQzMDMzOTA5M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjc4MTg4Nw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A male stripper teaches a younger performer how to party, pick up women, and make easy money.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1915581/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"preppy-3"},"dateCreated":"2012-06-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"Aside from the stripping there's nothing new here but I was never bored","reviewBody":"This takes place in Florida. A 30 year old male stripper Magic Mike (Channing Tatum) meets young Adam (Alex Pettyfer) who has no direction in life. Mike takes him under his wing and gets him to be a stripper. He also romances Adams' sister Brooke (Cody Horn). But Adam gets hooked on drugs and things get dangerous.\n\nFirst let's get the nude issue out of the way. There is only one full frontal in the movie--it's off to the side, is partially blocked and is probably faked. It's also very funny. There's mostly butt shots only but all are from Tatum, Pettyfer and Adam Rodriguez. This movie is NOT about the nudity. The movie moves slow (although I was never bored) and main events happen off screen OR are never explained! Still the movie works. For one thing all the acting is good. I was surprised at how good Tatum was. I never thought he could act till this. He captures his character perfectly. Pettyfer was equally good as Adam. Even Matthew McConaughey was good as the group's owner named Dallas. The strip acts themselves are incredible. All the guys are in good shape and Tatum shows some moves that are jaw-dropping! However they're not shot in an exploitive fashion. They're done in a matter of fact way that actually makes them seem quite funny. This movie (script wise) shows us nothing new but it was well-made and entertaining. This is not just for women and gay men--I think everyone would enjoy it. I give it a 7.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":134945,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2012-06-29","keywords":"male stripper,male nudity,abs,stripper,party","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"No. 1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi889627417","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDdiNzgzZTMtOTI2YS00NTA5LWJkMTYtZDQ3ZDFmM2EzZGQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQUlNRGJWaWRlb1RodW1ibmFpbFNlcnZpY2U@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDdiNzgzZTMtOTI2YS00NTA5LWJkMTYtZDQ3ZDFmM2EzZGQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQUlNRGJWaWRlb1RodW1ibmFpbFNlcnZpY2U@._V1_.jpg","description":"Mike, an experienced stripper, takes a younger performer called The Kid under his wing and schools him in the arts of partying, picking up women, and making easy money."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1475594/","name":"Channing Tatum"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1641117/","name":"Alex Pettyfer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1601397/","name":"Olivia Munn"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001752/","name":"Steven Soderbergh"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0380595/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0265102/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0332172/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1730221/","name":"Reid Carolin"}],"duration":"PT1H50M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Ne croyez surtout pas que je hurle
Ne croyez surtout pas que je hurle
programme.desc: Ne croyez surtout pas que je hurle: Directed by Frank Beauvais. January 2016. The love story that brought me to this village in Alsace where I live ended six months ago. At 45, I am now alone, without a car, a job or any real prospects, surrounded by luxuriant nature, the proximity of which is not enough to calm the deep distress into which I am plunged. France, still in shock from the November terror attacks, is in a state of emergency. I feel helpless, I suffocate with contained rage. I am lost and I watch four to five films a day. I decide to record this stagnation, not by picking up a camera but by editing shots from the stream of films I watch." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9680914/","name":"Ne croyez surtout pas que je hurle","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2NmZWNhNzktOGI0OC00MDZiLWJhNTMtZjg1OTgxYTIxN2M3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzkyNjcxNA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"January 2016. The love story that brought me to this village in Alsace where I live ended six months ago. programme.title: The Boat That Rocked
Good Morning England
programme.desc:
The Boat That Rocked: Directed by Richard Curtis. With Michael Hadley, Charlie Rowe, Lucy Fleming, Philip Seymour Hoffman. A band of rogue DJs that captivated Britain, playing the music that defined a generation and standing up to a government that wanted classical music, and nothing else, on the airwaves." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1131729/","name":"The Boat That Rocked","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTMzMjYzMTMyM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTk5NDA5Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A band of rogue DJs that captivated Britain, playing the music that defined a generation and standing up to a government that wanted classical music, and nothing else, on the airwaves.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1131729/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"birkir16"},"dateCreated":"2009-08-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"A simple "feel good" movie","reviewBody":"I'm going to keep this short. Watched it, loved it. 

It's a simple, "feel good" movie with the greatest music of the 60's and 70's that will make you smile. Sure it's not realistic when it comes to peoples communications and reactions to certain incidents but thats the charm of it. It even has a little twist of drama but not enough to ruin the comedy. 

It was amazing to me how the soundtrack just managed to get better and better, endless amount of rock/pop singles, thoughts like "aaaa i love that song" and " ohh man i had forgotten that one" often occurred to me. 

I thought the characters and the actors were great although some of the characters we're a bit useless i liked them after i was about 20 min into the film. 

I think we could use some pirate rock stations where i live, stations that will play and say what ever they please.

Final words. A movie witch is fun to watch.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":109344,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Music"],"datePublished":"2009-04-01","keywords":"pirate radio station,pop music,pirate radio,1960s,pirate broadcasting","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Pirate Radio","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1266090521","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2ODk3MTE4MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjM5NDYzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2ODk3MTE4MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjM5NDYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A comedy about an illegal radio station in the North Sea in the 1960s"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000450/","name":"Philip Seymour Hoffman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0631490/","name":"Bill Nighy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0296545/","name":"Nick Frost"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0193485/","name":"Richard Curtis"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047476/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0057311/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0193485/","name":"Richard Curtis"}],"duration":"PT2H15M"}</script><metacontent="

Watched it, loved it. 

It's a simple, "feel good" movie with the greatest music of the 60's and 70's that will make you smile. Sure it's not realistic when it comes to peoples communications and reactions to certain incidents but thats the charm of it. It even has a little twist of drama but not enough to ruin the comedy. 

It was amazing to me how the soundtrack just managed to get better and better, endless amount of rock/pop singles, thoughts like "aaaa i love that song" and " ohh man i had forgotten that one" often occurred to me. 

I thought the characters and the actors were great although some of the characters we're a bit useless i liked them after i was about 20 min into the film.

programme.title: Généalogies d'un crime
Généalogies d'un crime
programme.desc: Généalogies d'un crime: Directed by Raúl Ruiz. With Catherine Deneuve, Michel Piccoli, Melvil Poupaud, Andrzej Seweryn. At her son's funeral, Solange, a lawyer famous for losing hopeless cases, agrees to defend René, her son's age, accused of murdering his wealthy aunt, Jeanne, who's part of the Franco-Belgian Psychoanalytic Society, known for odd views and methods. She reads Jeanne's journal, documenting René's criminal tendencies. Solange believes him innocent, manipulated into the murder or framed. Odd psychiatrists turn up, including Georges Didier, who runs FBPS, and his rival, Christian, who believes crime originates in a story's taking hold of a person. After the verdict, René and Solange's relationship changes, Georges and his society commit a bizarre act, and the police record Solange's story." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0119242/","name":"Généalogies d'un crime","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA3NzkyNTM4Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTQwNTA0MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"At her son's funeral, Solange, a lawyer famous for losing hopeless cases, agrees to defend René, her son's age, accused of murdering his wealthy aunt, Jeanne, who's part of the Franco-Belgian Psychoanalytic Society, known for odd vie","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0119242/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Xparanoid"},"dateCreated":"2004-12-12","inLanguage":"English","name":""You'll be me and I'll be you...... Beep!"","reviewBody":"If some directors make the cut into stardom and acknowledge maybe this isn't the gold for Raoul Ruiz. This great chilean director is one of the best on making a film completely out of new processed lines of ideas, brave imaginary and a perfectly narrated line of events that are shocking sometimes and very recreational through the whole story. In this film Catherine Deneuve shows her grace with a comfortably effortless acting being a legal attorney who solves a mystery on an assassination of a remarkable psychologist. Sometimes you see her good side, the intrigued professional that tries to form a bind with her young client Rene, the first suspect on the murder of his aunt the psychologist, but sometimes you get to see nothing but the real game. That is the true central object of the plot, about how the truth come to reveal to ourselves by being other people, or better said, by placing ourselves in other's perspective. Big twist at the end, and it was before our eyes every time.\n\n*notice the great adjustements on the camera lens through the film. Some filters and a half of screen out of focus with traveling at the same time!!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":873,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1997-03-26","keywords":"reference to the brothers karamazov the novel,nonlinear timeline,told in flashback,defense lawyer,murder of aunt","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000366/","name":"Catherine Deneuve"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0681566/","name":"Michel Piccoli"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0693799/","name":"Melvil Poupaud"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0749914/","name":"Raúl Ruiz"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0012500/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0067852/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028557/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0749914/","name":"Raúl Ruiz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0094726/","name":"Pascal Bonitzer"}],"duration":"PT1H54M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Monsieur N
programme.desc: Film historique.

programme.title: Reviens
programme.desc: Un couple qui pratique l'adultère, se livre à une série d'expériences érotiques au gré des rencontres dans leur entourage ou leur vie professionnelle.

programme.title: Barnie et ses petites contrariétés
programme.desc: Barnie vit à Calais avec Lucie, son épouse, mais à Londres, où il travaille, il a une jeune maîtresse et un amant, la jolie Margot et le séduisant Mark. Soucieux de protéger son couple, il règle chaque détail de son existence. Jusqu'au jour où Lucie, Margot et Mark décident chacun de son côté de l'emmener en voyage au même moment et au même endroit. Barnie envoie un mot d'excuse à ses deux amants, mais intervertit les lettres, entraînant leur courroux.

programme.title: Reines d'un jour
programme.desc: La journée s'annonce ordinaire pour Marie Larue, 24 ans, Luis Del Sol, paisible conducteur de bus, Hortense Lassalle, orthophoniste, et Maurice Degombert, cuisinier au chômage. Et pourtant, Marie se découvre enceinte, avant d'avoir un accident et d'être licenciée. Luis, quant à lui, sent le ciel lui tomber sur la tête quand sa femme l'informe qu'elle a décidé de le quitter. Pour sa part, Hortense, est déterminée à profiter d'un voyage d'affaires de son mari, Antoine, pour vivre une folle nuit d'amour.

programme.title: Au nom de la liberté
programme.desc: Afrique du sud, 1980. Alors que le monde se lève contre l'apartheid, Patrick Chamusso, ne fait pas de politique. Bien qu'innocent, il est suspecté du sabotage de la raffinerie de pétrole dans laquelle il travaille. Mais Patrick est mal préparé aux interrogatoires brutaux des hommes de Vos, colonel de police chargé de la sécurité. Precious, la femme de Patrick, est à son tour jetée en prison et torturée. Une fois libéré, Patrick est désormais un autre homme. Il devient un rebelle et un combattant politique.

programme.title: Blier, Leconte, Tavernier, trois vies de cinéma
programme.desc: L'acteur et réalisateur Chad Chenouga réunit Bertrand Blier, Patrice Leconte et Bertrand Tavernier autour de leur passion du cinéma. Ces trois grands cinéastes populaires, à la filmographie impressionnante, ont commencé à réaliser des films dans les années 1960, mais c'est à partir du milieu des années 1970 que leurs carrières ont véritablement décollé. Au moment où Blier réalisait "Les Valseuses", en 1974, Tavernier tournait "L'horloger de Saint-Paul" tandis que, peu de temps après, Leconte mettait en scène "Les Bronzés". Ce documentaire tient le pari de les faire échanger sans langue de bois sur leurs carrières respectives ainsi que sur le cinéma français d'aujourd'hui.

programme.title: Catherine Frot, tous ces yeux qui vous regardent...
programme.desc: Ce documentaire retrace le parcours singulier de Catherine Frot. La comédienne a connu la notoriété sur le tard avec notamment le succès du long-métrage "Un air de faimille" de Cédric Klapisch. Le film a été adapté de la piècle éponyme pour laquelle Catherine Frot a reçu le Molière de meilleure comédienne dans un second rôle.

programme.title: Diva
programme.desc: Film policier.

programme.title: Mary Shelley
programme.desc: Jeune femme passionnée d'écriture, Mary Wollstonecraft Godwin invente des histoires de fantômes. Sa relation avec sa belle-mère devenant de plus en plus compliquée, son père l'envoie en Ecosse chez un ami. Là, elle y rencontre Percy Shelley, un poète talentueux, irrévérencieux et déjà marié depuis cinq ans. De retour à Londres parce que sa demi-soeur est malade, elle se désespère de son absence jusqu'à ce que Percy décide la rejoindre. En dépit des convenances sociales, du scandale menaçant, ils vont entamer une liaison passionnelle.

programme.title: Richard Dindo, pages choisies
programme.desc: Jean-Louis Comolli, ancien rédacteur en chef des "Cahiers du cinéma", dialogue avec le cinéaste suisse Richard Dindo, auteur d'une trentaine de documentaires.

programme.title: Ex Libris : New York Public Library
programme.desc: Frédérick Wiseman propose de découvrir l'immense réseau des bibliothèques new-yorkaises, estampillées New York Public Library. Les adhérents déambules entre les rangées de livres et les grandes salles de travail.

programme.title: Creepshow
programme.desc: Dans sa chambre encombrée de monstres en plastique, le jeune Billy est plongé dans la lecture de sa bande dessinée horrifique préférée, « Creepshow ». Son père, furieux, fait irruption, et lui confisque la revue. Celle-ci finit dans la poubelle située devant la maison. Puni, Billy voit soudain apparaître à la fenêtre de sa chambre le spectral The Creep, son héros favori. Cinq récits cauchemardesques prennent alors vie : « La Fête des pères », « La mort solitaire de Jordy Verrill », « Un truc pour se marrer » et « La Caisse » et « Ça grouille de partout ».

programme.title: Frankenstein 90
programme.desc: Le docteur Frankenstein, un descendant de l'illustre famille du même nom, met au point une créature qu'il baptise Frank. Sa fiancée l'aide à fabriquer un second être pour satisfaire les appétits sexuels de Frank.

programme.title: Marche à l'ombre
programme.desc: Deux amis, François, un musicien, et Denis, un éternel insatisfait, décident de tenter leur chance à Paris avec très peu d'argent en poche. Ils passent leur première nuit dans un hôtel sordide où ils font la connaissance de Joseph. Leur nouvel ami les invite à partager un logement qu'il squatte avec des cousins. Bientôt, François rencontre l'éclatante Mathilde, dont il tombe instantanément amoureux.

programme.title: Sexy birthday
programme.desc: Mia vient de vivre une rupture particulièrement difficile. Pour tenter de tourner la page et se changer les idées, elle invite son ami Simon à venir fêter son anniversaire avec elle et ses meilleures amies Kristen et Sara. Tous les quatre s'apprêtent à vivre une nuit riche en surprises où ils auront l'occasion d'assouvir leurs fantasmes les plus inavouables.

programme.title: Larry Crowne
Il n'est jamais trop tard
programme.desc: Larry Crowne: Directed by Tom Hanks. With Tom Hanks, Sarah Mahoney, Roxana Ortega, Randall Park. After losing his job, a middle-aged man reinvents himself by going back to college." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1583420/","name":"Larry Crowne","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjQ4MzlmZDUtN2ViMi00ZTAwLWFkMmItNGRlZmM1NjQ1ZmJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzI0NDc4ODY@._V1_.jpg","description":"After losing his job, a middle-aged man reinvents himself by going back to college.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1583420/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"tub51461"},"dateCreated":"2015-12-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"Connects easily with the public","reviewBody":"This movie is simply a movie in which Tom Hanks wrote, directed, and acted in, not for pure entertainment value. There's some humor in it, but the ultimate goal is that it's strictly written as a means to connect with anyone who has ever been cut from a job which paid the bills, paid the mortgage, paid the student loans, paid any car loans, etc. then nothing, no job, credit is overdrawn, house, car, & lucky if they don't lose their shirt. It's the way of the world for the last 10 years and that's Tom Hanks' message to the audience: How can we adjust to this sudden hole in our lives? Well, the movie subtly gives you a lot of answers. If you ever been out of your element, then you'll enjoy this film.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":65917,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2011-07-01","keywords":"character name as title,unsuccessful,male protagonist,feet,high heels","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Larry Crowne - Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1973459993","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIxOTc0NDY2N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDk0NTk1NQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIxOTc0NDY2N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDk0NTk1NQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"After losing his job, a middle-aged man (Tom Hanks) reinvents himself by going back to college."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000158/","name":"Tom Hanks"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000210/","name":"Julia Roberts"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2089529/","name":"Sarah Mahoney"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000158/","name":"Tom Hanks"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0251081/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047476/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000158/","name":"Tom Hanks"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0889522/","name":"Nia Vardalos"}],"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Fonzy
Fonzy
programme.desc:
Fonzy: Directed by Isabelle Doval. With José Garcia, Audrey Fleurot, Lucien Jean-Baptiste, Gérard Hernandez. A fish deliveryman in Paris becomes involved in a legal battle with his sperm donation children." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3077818/","name":"Fonzy","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY5NjEwODgwOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTcwMzAxMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A fish deliveryman in Paris becomes involved in a legal battle with his sperm donation children.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3077818/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Platypuschow"},"dateCreated":"2018-11-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"Fonzy: But why?","reviewBody":"Fonzy is the French remake of the excellent French Canadian movie Starbuck (2011) Which was also remade as a Bollywood movie and got the Holllywood treatment in 2013 as The Delivery Man.

It's one of the those bizzare remakes which is an almost scene for scene clone complete with near identical script. Which begs the question, why?

Truly what is the point? It's even in the same language as the original so there is no accessibility issue for people who don't like subtitles.

Once again it tells the story of a man approached by a lawyer and notified that he has over 500 children via sperm donations he made 20yrs prior. A percentage of the kids want to know who he is and a court case will take place.

Truth be told it's a wonderful story, the original was excellent and even the US version was highly enjoyable but what's with all the senseless remakes?

Fonzy is a competently made version, it just shouldn't have been made.

Want to see this wonderful story? Watch Starbuck (2011) instead.

The Good:

The same sweet, heartfelt story

Lead was competent

The Bad:

Simply shouldn't exist

Things I Learnt From This Movie:

I'll never understand the logic of carbon copy remakes","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":576,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.2},"genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2013-10-30","keywords":"winter,snow,male masturbation,sperm donor,playboy magazine","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1172356121","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGYxMDc5M2YtZDcxYy00NzMyLTgxZDMtYjBhODZjMDUyMjg1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGYxMDc5M2YtZDcxYy00NzMyLTgxZDMtYjBhODZjMDUyMjg1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0305296/","name":"José Garcia"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1109153/","name":"Audrey Fleurot"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0419894/","name":"Lucien Jean-Baptiste"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0227570/","name":"Isabelle Doval"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0190089/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047476/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0079764/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0227570/","name":"Isabelle Doval"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0305296/","name":"José Garcia"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0677587/","name":"Martin Petit"}],"duration":"PT1H43M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Une affaire qui roule
Une affaire qui roule
programme.desc:
Une affaire qui roule: Directed by Eric Veniard. With Clovis Cornillac, Denis Podalydès, Axelle Laffont, Husky Kihal. Having resigned to open his own restaurant, a talented cook, but without the skills to run a business, meets an internship facilitator who dreams of becoming a writer." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0306174/","name":"Une affaire qui roule","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkzODEzMjU1Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDQ0MzAwMQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Having resigned to open his own restaurant, a talented cook, but without the skills to run a business, meets an internship facilitator who dreams of becoming a writer.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0306174/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"JanMnstr"},"dateCreated":"2012-02-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Nice, but to be missed without a problem","reviewBody":"Since this title has not yet a plot/synopsis a quick recap of the movie is below my short review.

It is a pleasant enough movie. But I kept grabbing my I-pad to something more interesting and/or exciting. The story and developments could have been done in 30 minutes. But alas, they did it in 90 minutes, leading to too little pace, too little jokes and scenes that do not matter. On the other hand, if you feel like a couch potato, like I did while watching, than it flows nicely, not expecting anything from you as a spectator. But if you do not see this one, you did not miss anything important.

So for you who are still interested the storyline: Jean-Jacques is a highly creative chef, but his imaginative duck rolls are not at all appreciated by his boss. The time has come for him to leave his secure job behind and open his own restaurant... Claude is a instructor for corporate entrepreneurs, but he would prefer to be a writer. It's time for him to give it all up and finally write his novel... Together, the two men could offer each other support in times of need, no longer be under stress and make their dreams come true...","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":114,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6},"genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2003-01-01","keywords":"male objectification,male full frontal nudity,hairy chest,pubic hair,male pubic hair","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0180404/","name":"Clovis Cornillac"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0687914/","name":"Denis Podalydès"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0480831/","name":"Axelle Laffont"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0893107/","name":"Eric Veniard"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0090290/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028908/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0070074/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0893107/","name":"Eric Veniard"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0452723/","name":"Husky Kihal"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1065892/","name":"Julie Lopes-Curval"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Cinémiam !
programme.desc: En partant du constat que la cuisine et le cinéma ont beaucoup d'ingrédients en commun : la fabrication d'un produit élaboré, un travail d'équipe, une finalité de plaisir à offrir à autrui, et surtout, un chef, la réalisatrice Anne Martinetti a concocté un documentaire où de grands chefs étoilés interroge le cinéma, et les réalisateurs évoquent les films autour de la cuisine qui les ont marqués : L'AILE OU LA CUISSE, LE GRAND RESTAURANT, AU PETIT MARGUERY, BARBECUE, À VIF... Un dialogue riche et gourmand émaillé d'extraits de films dont certaines scènes cocasses ont fait le tour du monde...

The Keeper
programme.desc:
Trautmann: Directed by Marcus H. Rosenmüller. With David Kross, Freya Mavor, John Henshaw, Harry Melling. The love story of a young English woman and a German PoW, who together overcome prejudice, public hostility and personal tragedy." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4642192/","name":"Trautmann","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGY2ODI0NDMtMmViMS00NGI2LWJlYWQtODk4NzlkNGVmMjU0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzE1ODI0OTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"The love story of a young English woman and a German PoW, who together overcome prejudice, public hostility and personal tragedy.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4642192/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mike_lowe_1"},"dateCreated":"2019-03-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Brilliant!","reviewBody":"A truly heartwarming story of reconciliation and the human condition. I watched this film in the Cinema in St. Helens. A town that is close to my heart and that features in Bert Trautmann's story before his time playing for Manchester City.

This movie is about so much more than football. I'm largely disinterested in the beautiful game but even I was bowled over by the brilliant humour and heartwarming story of redemption and reconciliation.

Watch this movie, tell your friends about it and talk about it. It deserves to be seen both on its own merit and as one of the few films to represent working class northerners in a human light, displaying their unique sense of humour and kindness as well as dealing with the emotional fallout of war in a mature way.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4609,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"genre":["Biography","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2019-03-14","keywords":"year 1944,year 1945,year 1951,singing in a car,year 1956","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1657192217","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGQ4YmNlNTMtNTRmNS00NTUxLWI0ZTktYzRjZmM2YjYzNDE1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGQ4YmNlNTMtNTRmNS00NTUxLWI0ZTktYzRjZmM2YjYzNDE1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1269088/","name":"David Kross"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4087606/","name":"Freya Mavor"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0378132/","name":"John Henshaw"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1455707/","name":"Marcus H. programme.title: Babel
Babel
programme.desc: Babel: Directed by Alejandro G. Iñárritu. With Brad Pitt, Cate Blanchett, Mohamed Akhzam, Peter Wight. Tragedy strikes a married couple on vacation in the Moroccan desert, touching off an interlocking story involving four different families." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0449467/","name":"Babel","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTJkZDljNGYtNjRiNC00ZmY2LTg1NmItYTI1MTllNDQzMWVmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxODk2OTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"Tragedy strikes a married couple on vacation in the Moroccan desert, touching off an interlocking story involving four different families.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0449467/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"pb104-1"},"dateCreated":"2006-09-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"interesting, complex tale","reviewBody":"The film opens in the Moroccan desert: an elderly tribesman trades a high-powered rifle to a goat herder for 500 diram & a goat. He hands the rifle to his two young sons and tells them to kill jackals with it, to protect the herd. As practice, the start shooting at rocks, a car passing on the hill below, and finally a bus. That's the only thing they manage to hit, putting a bullet through the shoulder of a tourist. In the middle of nowhere, there's no medical help, and no one wants to wait with the injured person except her husband. That's the setup of this complex, challenging film. It splits into four related stories, one in Japan, two in Morocco, and the last in California, where a housekeeper has to get to her son's wedding in Mexico, but has no one to watch the two children in her care. She decides to take them along, and of course things go sour. A good cast, great acting, fine cinematography, and expert direction make this film well worth watching. It's not for everyone, but for people who are ready to see deliberately paced low-key thriller, this is one good film. IMDb data; ttnr: 0449467, Title: Babel, --- Description: Babel: Directed by Alejandro G. Iñárritu. With Brad Pitt, Cate Blanchett, Mohamed Akhzam, Peter Wight. Tragedy strikes a married couple on vacation in the Moroccan desert, touching off an interlocking story involving four different families." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0449467/","name":"Babel","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTJkZDljNGYtNjRiNC00ZmY2LTg1NmItYTI1MTllNDQzMWVmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxODk2OTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"Tragedy strikes a married couple on vacation in the Moroccan desert, touching off an interlocking story involving four different families.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0449467/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"pb104-1","dateCreated":"2006-09-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"interesting, complex tale","reviewBody":"The film opens in the Moroccan desert: an elderly tribesman trades a high-powered rifle to a goat herder for 500 diram & a goat. He hands the rifle to his two young sons and tells them to kill jackals with it, to protect the herd. As practice, the start shooting at rocks, a car passing on the hill below, and finally a bus. That's the only thing they manage to hit, putting a bullet through the shoulder of a tourist. In the middle of nowhere, there's no medical help, and no one wants to wait with the injured person except her husband. That's the setup of this complex, challenging film. It splits into four related stories, one in Japan, two in Morocco, and the last in California, where a housekeeper has to get to her son's wedding in Mexico, but has no one to watch the two children in her care. She decides to take them along, and of course things go sour. A good cast, great acting, fine cinematography, and expert direction make this film well worth watching. It's not for everyone, but for people who are ready to see deliberately paced low-key thriller, this is one good film. The split story line is reminiscent of "Syriana," but in no way copies it.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":295991,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2007-03-07","keywords":"deaf girl,cultural difference,language barrier,original story,public nudity","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Babel","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2058879257","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmVmZmY2NjctMTVmNi00ZGMzLWI1NDUtMTkyODdmZTA5OWIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmVmZmY2NjctMTVmNi00ZGMzLWI1NDUtMTkyODdmZTA5OWIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Paramount","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000093/","name":"Brad Pitt","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000949/","name":"Cate Blanchett","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0305558/","name":"Gael García Bernal"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0327944/","name":"Alejandro G. programme.title: La reine Margot
La reine Margot
programme.desc: La reine Margot: Directed by Patrice Chéreau. With Isabelle Adjani, Daniel Auteuil, Jean-Hugues Anglade, Vincent Perez. Young Queen Margot finds herself trapped in an arranged marriage amidst a religious war between Catholics and Protestants. She hopes to escape with a new lover, but finds herself imprisoned by her powerful and ruthless family." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0110963/","name":"La reine Margot","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTc4NTdjODgtZmI1MS00MDI5LWFhZjYtMjAzNTVhYzk1ZjFiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTA0MjU0Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Young Queen Margot finds herself trapped in an arranged marriage amidst a religious war between Catholics and Protestants. She hopes to escape with a new lover, but finds herself imprisoned by her powerful and ruthless family.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0110963/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Filmangel002"},"dateCreated":"2001-05-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"Historically inaccurate and insulting","reviewBody":"I found this film appauling. I have intensively studied the life of Marguerite de Valois and found that the only thing this film, and Alexandra Dumas, got right was her name. She was NOT lustful and loose. She was a very inteligent and sophisticated women, even hailed as a genious by the people of her age. A women 400 years before her time. The writers didn't even get the age she died at correct. They said she died at 68... she died at 62!!! She lived from 1553-1615. You do the math. If the film had any other title and didn't claim to be about Margot, it would be an incredible film! The imagery was beautiful and the costumes, while at times were inaccurate as well, were fabulous. The wedding was very well done, even though the real colors used were blue and gold. I liked, however, that they used the color red as the main theme, since the focus was on the St. Bartholomew day Massacre. That scene was a bit long, and the gore was at times unnecessary, but it showed the horror that the Protestants underwent that night. Isabelle Adjani and Virna Lisi were very good in their roles as was Vincent Perez. One thing I found fascinating was that the gentleman who played Henry de Navarre looked exactly like the real Henry of Navarre as seen in paintings done during his life. While I was disapointed that the French made a film out of the Alexandra Dumas novel since he was so wrong about everything, if you're able to look past all the inaccuracies about her, you can truly enjoy this film."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":16964,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Drama","History"],"datePublished":"1994-05-13","keywords":"male frontal nudity,female frontal nudity,sex,female nudity,pubic hair","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Re-release Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3588074777","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDkwMjg0MTc2Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDYxODk2MTE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDkwMjg0MTc2Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDYxODk2MTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Queen Margot"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000254/","name":"Isabelle Adjani"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000809/","name":"Daniel Auteuil"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000767/","name":"Jean-Hugues Anglade"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0161717/","name":"Patrice Chéreau"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0067540/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0056755/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0072956/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0241416/","name":"Alexandre Dumas"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0860019/","name":"Danièle Thompson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0161717/","name":"Patrice Chéreau"}],"duration":"PT2H39M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Other Boleyn Girl
Deux soeurs pour un roi
programme.desc:
The Other Boleyn Girl: Directed by Justin Chadwick. With Natalie Portman, Scarlett Johansson, Eric Bana, Jim Sturgess. Two sisters contend for the affection of King Henry VIII." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0467200/","name":"The Other Boleyn Girl","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ2NTg1Mjk1Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwODI5Njk3._V1_.jpg","description":"Two sisters contend for the affection of King Henry VIII.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0467200/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"blackburnj-1"},"dateCreated":"2008-03-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Satisfying and entertaining, but it promised so much more","reviewBody":"The Tudors are very chic at the moment. If it isn't "Elizabeth: The Golden Age" (awful) or the television series, "The Tudors" (soft-pornographic trash), then it is "The Other Boleyn Girl", the latest film written by the Oscar nominated screenwriter, Peter Morgan. After his work on the Golden Globe winning TV film "Longford" and the Oscar winning (for its lead actors) "The Queen" and "The Last King of Scotland", his scripts must be in demand by actors across the globe. Little wonder then that this film attracts a stellar cast, including Eric Bana, Scarlett Johansson and Natalie Portman. So, why is it that this film, which is filled with great talent and potential, delivers only satisfaction? This was originally slated for release late last year, right in the middle of the awards season. Yet, for some reason, it was moved back. Why this was done is not widely known, but, as the IMDb had the film listed as completed last autumn, I should think that the decision was taken that this film would draw more attention outside of the congested awards season. Watching the film, you are aware of the ambition and lavish costumes that would draw the gaze of Oscar. But the film lacks punch, depth and the power to grip you the whole way through.

That's not to say that it isn't entertaining. Far from it, the film is, for an hour and a quarter, perfectly pleasant, with intrigue, scheming and romance aplenty. A lot of the credit must go to the performances, which range from accomplished to fantastically enjoyable to watch. Natalie Portman is impressive as Anne Boleyn. She ranges from scheming and nasty to genuinely sympathetic. It is her most notable work to date. Scarlett Johansson is fine, but everybody is still waiting for her to realise the potential she showed when she announced herself on the scene in "Lost in Translation" and "The Girl with the Pearl Earring". The supporting cast are a joy to watch. Eric Bana is excellent as Henry VIII, but it is the schemers in the background who provide the best entertainment. David Morrissey is having a lot of fun, whilst Mark Rylance and Kristin Scott Thomas are great as the Boleyn parents.

It is a perfectly bearable watch, but unfulfilling. There's an awful lot crammed into the hour and fifty minutes. As year after year of history is skipped through, the film's focus continually shifts, failing to allow certain characters from gaining appropriate intensity. Henry VIII is not as proactive as he might, or should, be. He is more driven then driving, whilst his first wife, Catherine of Aragon (Ana Torrent), is given very little time on screen, thus sidelining a character which should be a figure of great interest. But your expectations are dashed mainly because the film reaches its climax with half-an-hour to go, with an emotional pinnacle being reached and never again surpassed. A rape scene, which seems to be the start of the culmination, with so many points of interest going on in it, proves to be the end of it. The last thirty minutes, whilst quite stylish, are drawn out and slow, and end with a final scene that can only be described as cheesy.

It's a shame that this film is nothing more than admirable in places. But it is a good film for this time of year (that springtime lull between the quality of Winter and the bombast entertainment of Summer). It is an entertaining and satisfying way to pass an afternoon, but it won't live long in the memory.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":108587,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Biography","Drama","History"],"datePublished":"2008-06-04","keywords":"court,nightgown,death,sister sister relationship,rape","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Other Boleyn Girl","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1404174617","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE3NDY1MjEzM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTM4NjYzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE3NDY1MjEzM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTM4NjYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Other Boleyn Girl Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000204/","name":"Natalie Portman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0424060/","name":"Scarlett Johansson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0051509/","name":"Eric Bana"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0149491/","name":"Justin Chadwick"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0042399/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103694/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0604948/","name":"Peter Morgan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0339925/","name":"Philippa Gregory"}],"duration":"PT1H55M"}</script><metacontent="

Two sisters contend for the affection of King Henry VIII." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0467200/","name":"The Other Boleyn Girl","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ2NTg1Mjk1Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwODI5Njk3._V1_.jpg","description":"Two sisters contend for the affection of King Henry VIII.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0467200/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"blackburnj-1","dateCreated":"2008-03-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Satisfying and entertaining, but it promised so much more","reviewBody":"The Tudors are very chic at the moment. If it isn't "Elizabeth: The Golden Age" (awful) or the television series, "The Tudors" (soft-pornographic trash), then it is "The Other Boleyn Girl", the latest film written by the Oscar nominated screenwriter, Peter Morgan. After his work on the Golden Globe winning TV film "Longford" and the Oscar winning (for its lead actors) "The Queen" and "The Last King of Scotland", his scripts must be in demand by actors across the globe. Little wonder then that this film attracts a stellar cast, including Eric Bana, Scarlett Johansson and Natalie Portman. So, why is it that this film, which is filled with great talent and potential, delivers only satisfaction? This was originally slated for release late last year, right in the middle of the awards season. Yet, for some reason, it was moved back. Why this was done is not widely known, but, as the IMDb had the film listed as completed last autumn, I should think that the decision was taken that this film would draw more attention outside of the congested awards season. Watching the film, you are aware of the ambition and lavish costumes that would draw the gaze of Oscar. But the film lacks punch, depth and the power to grip you the whole way through.

That's not to say that it isn't entertaining. Far from it, the film is, for an hour and a quarter, perfectly pleasant, with intrigue, scheming and romance aplenty. A lot of the credit must go to the performances, which range from accomplished to fantastically enjoyable to watch. Natalie Portman is impressive as Anne Boleyn. She ranges from scheming and nasty to genuinely sympathetic. It is her most notable work to date. Scarlett Johansson is fine, but everybody is still waiting for her to realise the potential she showed when she announced herself on the scene in "Lost in Translation" and "The Girl with the Pearl Earring". The supporting cast are a joy to watch. Eric Bana is excellent as Henry VIII, but it is the schemers in the background who provide the best entertainment. David Morrissey is having a lot of fun, whilst Mark Rylance and Kristin Scott Thomas are great as the Boleyn parents.

It is a perfectly bearable watch, but unfulfilling. There's an awful lot crammed into the hour and fifty minutes. As year after year of history is skipped through, the film's focus continually shifts, failing to allow certain characters from gaining appropriate intensity. Henry VIII is not as proactive as he might, or should, be. He is more driven then driving, whilst his first wife, Catherine of Aragon (Ana Torrent), is given very little time on screen, thus sidelining a character which should be a figure of great interest. But your expectations are dashed mainly because the film reaches its climax with half-an-hour to go, with an emotional pinnacle being reached and never again surpassed. A rape scene, which seems to be the start of the culmination, with so many points of interest going on in it, proves to be the end of it. The last thirty minutes, whilst quite stylish, are drawn out and slow, and end with a final scene that can only be described as cheesy.

It's a shame that this film is nothing more than admirable in places. But it is a good film for this time of year (that springtime lull between the quality of Winter and the bombast entertainment of Summer). It is an entertaining and satisfying way to pass an afternoon, but it won't live long in the memory.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":108587,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Biography","Drama","History"],"datePublished":"2008-06-04","keywords":"court,nightgown,death,sister sister relationship,rape","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Other Boleyn Girl","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1404174617","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE3NDY1MjEzM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTM4NjYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE3NDY1MjEzM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTM4NjYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Other Boleyn Girl Trailer","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000204/","name":"Natalie Portman","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0424060/","name":"Scarlett Johansson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0051509/","name":"Eric Bana"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0149491/","name":"Justin Chadwick"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0042399/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103694/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0604948/","name":"Peter Morgan","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0339925/","name":"Philippa Gregory"],"duration":"PT1H55M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Million Dollar Baby
Million Dollar Baby
programme.desc: Million Dollar Baby: Directed by Clint Eastwood. With Clint Eastwood, Hilary Swank, Morgan Freeman, Jay Baruchel. A determined woman works with a hardened boxing trainer to become a professional." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0405159/","name":"Million Dollar Baby","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkxNzA1NDQxOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTkyMTIzMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A determined woman works with a hardened boxing trainer to become a professional.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0405159/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"delcash006"},"dateCreated":"2004-12-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Loved The Ride","reviewBody":"Million Dollar Baby is a movie about boxing like Braveheart is a movie about men in kilts riding horses. What it is is a movie to experience if you find yourself ever entertaining thoughts about loyalty, determination, talent, no talent, age, youth, courage, fear, fate, and the pain and joy of both living and dying.\n\nI read reviews of Million Dollar Baby and expected to like it. Roger Ebert can be soft on movies because he is plainly a big fan, but even he does not lightly toss around the M-word, masterpiece. Yet he drops it on MDB, and justly so. The story is simple and searing. A gal (Hilary Swank) with much heart and no experience aspires to be the champion of the world. She is Rocky in a sports bra. A grizzled fight trainer-manager/gym owner (Clint Eastwood) reluctantly takes her on. His best pal and wise-man assistant (Morgan Freemna) stands alongside them, as the plot unwinds steadily, seamlessly, picking up speed, scene by scene, act after act. Eastwood and Freeman are artists at the top of their profession and they, along with the brilliant Swank, present you the very worthy lives of three people you will care about and remember. The arena is boxing, but it might as well have been boating or baking. It is a story about values and truths that far exceed sports and movies. I walked into the Lowes Lincoln Square theater last night knowing Million Dollar Baby was taking me on a ride and willing to hop aboard. What a beautiful, memorable ride it was."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":659352,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.1},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Sport"],"datePublished":"2005-02-23","keywords":"boxing,determination,women boxing,boxing trainer,death","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"10th Anniversary Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4217158425","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2UxNmVkMzQtZGMyNS00N2VkLWJlZGItOWJiOTNkZWY3MDNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2UxNmVkMzQtZGMyNS00N2VkLWJlZGItOWJiOTNkZWY3MDNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005476/","name":"Hilary Swank"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000142/","name":"Clint Eastwood"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000151/","name":"Morgan Freeman"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000142/","name":"Clint Eastwood"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005323/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0010258/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0353673/","name":"Paul Haggis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0101801/","name":"F.X.
